alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 10:19PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Kit Carson County through 1045 PM MDT... At 1018 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bethune, or 7 miles west of Burlington, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Burlington around 1030 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 426 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 182 and 198. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM MDT for east central Colorado.
